item.title: Krs one
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

This is one of the few rappers that I don’t hate. Most rappers think they are cool and shit, while they are just lazy motherfuckers who should be brought back to a plantation. But this guy isn’t bad.

Read full topic

item.title: Krs one
item.dc:creator: @phonnygoblin phonnygoblin
item.description:
@phonnygoblin wrote:

He’s really really good. Plus this is a really good job of not ruining a classic. But I still think rappers like Jay-Z who went mainstream are good.

Read full topic

item.title: Krs one
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

KRS One has always been like this, never one to show off in expensive cars, always turned down big production deals that did require him to go against his beliefs, one of the reasons he never follow rap when it went mainstream.

Like i said, you’ll never see him wearing big expensive chains, rings etc. He is always dressing just like a regular person would. Don’t get me wrong though, he will get into “battles” with other rappers, but thats what rap is about - the little competition. When he first came out they had this plan to do all this real voilent rap stuff then do a big switch over to what they are doing now, you know preaching against it all to show them the both sides of the coin.

Read full topic

item.title: Krs one
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

With all the hate I give to rap…this was actually quite entertaining. And I actually believe everything he says.

The thing that gets me about rap is their sad attempt at almost a “violence sells” strategy.

Whereas this man has gone a complete different route, and in my opinion has done an amazing job.

Read full topic
